results.name: a(0) = 0, a(3n) = a(n), a(3n+1) = a(n)*3 + 1, a(3n-1) = a(n)*3 - 1.
comment: Defines a function on all the integers, but only nonnegative terms are in the data. A147991 gives the nonnegative fixed points of the function and the nonnegative part of its image.
Consider a Sierpinski arrowhead curve to be formed of vectors placed head to tail and numbered consecutively from 0 at its axis of symmetry. Vector a(n) equals vector n.
Removing all 0's from the balanced ternary expansion of n yields a(n). - _Charlie Neder_, Jun 03 2019
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..19683
Peter Munn, Sierpiński arrowhead with numbered vectors.
example: As 6 is congruent to 0 modulo 3, a(6) = a(3*2) = a(2).
As 2 is congruent to -1 modulo 3, a(2) = a(3*1 - 1) = a(1)*3 - 1.
As 1 is congruent to 1 modulo 3, a(1) = a(0*1 + 1) = a(0)*3 + 1 = 0*3 + 1 = 1.
program: (MAGMA) a:=[1]; for n in [2..80] do  if n mod 3 eq 2 then a[n]:= 3*a[(n+1) div 3]-1; end if; if n mod 3 eq 1 then a[n]:=3*a[(n-1) div 3]+1; end if; if n mod 3 eq 0 then a[n]:=a[n div 3]; end if; end for; [0] cat a; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Nov 14 2019
